# primertools

[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-pkgdown-blue.svg)](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/)

The `primertools` package provides helper functions for preparing
datasets for import into  
**[PRIMER-e](https://www.primer-e.com)** software, and for reading
common PRIMER output files  
(e.g.Â PERMANOVA results) for downstream analysis in R.

`primertools` is designed to support reproducible workflows that combine
PRIMER with R.  
It does **not** reimplement PRIMER analyses.

## About PRIMER

PRIMER is a widely used software package (made by PRIMER-e) for
multivariate analysis of ecological community data.  
Although R provides packages with overlapping functionality, PRIMER
software is the authoritative implementation for the routines it
provides.

- [PRIMER-e website](https://www.primer-e.com)
- [PRIMER-e learning hub](https://learninghub.primer-e.com/books)
- [Should I use PRIMER or
  R?](https://learninghub.primer-e.com/books/should-i-use-primer-or-r)

## Installation

You can install the development version of **primertools** from GitHub
with:

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("anhsmith/primertools")
```

``` r
library(primertools)
```

# Package index

## All functions

- [`add_taxon_group_order()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/add_taxon_group_order.md)
  : Add a within-facet ordering variable for SIMPER plots
- [`aic_permanova()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/aic_permanova.md)
  : AIC-like criterion for PERMANOVA models
- [`get_permanova_aic()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/get_permanova_aic.md)
  : Extract PERMANOVA AIC components from a PRIMER PERMANOVA table
- [`read_permanova_components_of_variation()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/read_permanova_components_of_variation.md)
  : Read PRIMER PERMANOVA "Estimates of components of variation" from a
  text output file
- [`read_permanova_results_table()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/read_permanova_results_table.md)
  : Read PRIMER PERMANOVA "table of results" from a text output file
- [`read_simper()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/read_simper.md)
  : Read a PRIMER SIMPER text output file (one-way)
- [`tidy_simper_between()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/tidy_simper_between.md)
  : Tidy a SIMPER object (between-group tables)
- [`tidy_simper_within()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/tidy_simper_within.md)
  : Tidy a SIMPER object (within-group tables)
- [`write_primer_csv()`](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/reference/write_primer_csv.md)
  : Write a PRIMER-ready CSV (samples, variables, factors, optional
  indicators)

  outputs](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/articles/permanova.md):

  CSV](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/articles/primer-csv-example.md):

  outputs](https://anhsmith.github.io/primertools/articles/read_simper.md):
